availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Ohio
Hamilton County } SS -

Personally appeared before me the undersigned a Notary Public duly commissioned and appointed by the Governor of the State of Ohio, and as such authorized to receive and attest oaths and affirmations taken in said County. John A Lynch of the City of Cincinnati who being first duly sworn maketh oath and saith that he will faithfully discharge all his duties as Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, under the Commission for that purpose directed to him by the Honble Thos E Bramlette the Governor of said State dated the 6th day of October 1865

J. A. Lynch
Comr of Deeds for State of Kentucky
Subscribed in my presence and sworn to before me this 9th day of October AD 1865.

William H. Mackay
Notary Public Hamilton Co. Ohio

Comr of Deeds
Ohio
Oath of John A Lynch
filed 12 Oct 1865
